title.rendered: Canada Targeted Express Entry Draw for Healthcare Workers ~ 500 Invitations

Share Tweet Share Pin
[vc_column_text]On June 27, 2023, IRCC held the first ever Targeted Express Entry targeted for Healthcare professionals. A total of 500 candidates were invited to this draw. The minimum CRS score required was 476, 10 points lower than the last general Express Entry Draw held on June 27, 2023. This marks the first of such draws since the announcement of the six new categories on May 31, with even more opportunities on the horizon.

The second round of Targeted Express Entry Draw is scheduled for July 5 and will see an impressive 1,500 workers being invited to apply. But that’s not all—brace yourself for another draw in the same week, specifically targeting science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) professions.

Targeted Express Entry Draw June 28, 2023 Results:

  • Express Entry Round: #252
  • Draw Type: Occupation-Based Targeted
  • Draw Date: June 28, 2023
  • CRS Cut-off Score: 476
  • No. of invitations: 500
  • Tie-breaking rule: November 12, 2022
[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” centered_text=”true” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Start Express Entry Assessment Now” url=”https://bit.ly/start-free-assessment”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]

Targeted Express Entry Draw for 35 Eligibile Healthcare Occupations

Healthcare occupations dominate the list of eligible professions selected under the Targeted Express Entry Occupation List, with a total of 35 occupations. From dentists and registered nurses to psychologists and physiotherapists, Canada is seeking talented individuals to address the critical shortage of healthcare workers. This shortage arises from a combination of Canada’s low birth rate and aging population, creating an urgent need for skilled immigrants to fill these vital roles.

Canada is calling for healthcare professionals to support its healthcare system and ensure a bright future for its citizens. With 144,500 vacant positions in the healthcare and social assistance sector, the demand for skilled workers is higher than ever. Various provinces and territories, such as Alberta, British Columbia, and Ontario, have already initiated targeted programs to attract healthcare professionals. It’s a testament to the immense opportunities awaiting qualified individuals in different regions across the country.

A Guide to Targeted Express Entry for Doctors in 2023

 

Check the detailed NOC TEER codes eligible for targeted Express Entry Draws under the Healthcare occupations below:

Eligibility Requirements for Targeted Express Entry Draw in 2023

To be eligible for the occupation-specific categories, candidates must have a minimum of six months of continuous work experience in one of the listed occupations:

  • French-language proficiency
  • Healthcare Occupations
  • Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) occupations
  • Skilled Trade occupations
  • Transport occupations (including Truck Drivers)
  • Agriculture and agri-food occupations

You must also meet all the eligibility requirements for one of the three economic immigration programs: the Federal Skilled Worker Program, the Canadian Experience Class, or the Federal Skilled Trades Program.

https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/blog/targeted-express-entry-for-nurses/[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Need Help with Your Canadian Immigration Journey?

If you’re a healthcare professional or a STEM expert dreaming of a rewarding career and a fulfilling life in Canada, now is the time to take action. Prepare yourself for an incredible journey as Canada welcomes skilled individuals like you to contribute to its thriving healthcare sector. We’re here to offer our expert guidance and support to make your dreams of living and working in Canada a reality.

Introducing Mr. Keshav Sharma, a highly qualified Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultant (RCIC) with specialized knowledge in healthcare and STEM occupations.

For a limited time, eligible healthcare and STEM candidates can take advantage of our comprehensive services starting at just CAD $999. Here’s what our tailored package includes:

  • Submission of a complete and accurate Express Entry profile and/or PNP Expression of Interest
  • Support with preparing documents in advance in anticipation of receiving an ITA
  • One-on-one ZOOM appointment with an RCIC to discuss your personalized case
  • On-going support from an RCIC throughout the process and even after

Take the first step towards transforming your aspiration of living and working in Canada into a reality by contacting us here or scheduling a consultation with us today.

Stay tuned for more updates on this exciting opportunity, and get ready to embark on a new chapter in your professional life.

excerpt.rendered: On Jun 28, 2023, Canada invited 500 candidates under the first ever Targeted Express Entry Draw for healthcare occupations. Candidates required a minimum CRS score of 476.
